item.title: PASS Summit 2011 Notes
item.description: PASS (Professional Association for SQL Server) is “an independent, user-led, not-for-profit organization co-founded by Microsoft and CA in 1999. PASS Summit is the world’s largest, most-focused, and most-intensive conference for Microsoft SQL Server and BI professionals.” (Source: the PASS website at sqlpass.org). The summit is held every year in Seattle. This year, the summit was held from October 11 to October 14 and focused on the upcoming RTM launch of SQL Server Denali, now re-branded as SQL Server 2012.
